app.core.dataset_handler.artifact_to_dataset(artifact: Artifact) → Dataset[source]

Converts an Artifact object to a Dataset object.

Parameters:

artifact (Artifact) – The Artifact object to be converted.

Returns:

A new Dataset object created from the given Artifact.

Return type:

Dataset

  • None. (input. Defaults to)

  • datasets. (available)

app.core.dataset_handler.get_all_file_paths(directory: str) → List[str][source]

Recursively retrieves all file paths from the specified directory.

directory (str) – The directory from which to retrieve file paths.

Returns:

app.core.dataset_handler.save_csv(automl: AutoMLSystem, file: UploadedFile) → None[source]

This function reads the uploaded CSV file, shows a preview of the data, and prompts the user to enter a dataset name and asset path. It then saves the dataset to the AutoML system using the provided name and asset path.

Parameters:

  • automl (AutoMLSystem) – The AutoML system instance where the dataset

  • saved. (be)

  • file (st.uploaded_file_manager.UploadedFile) – The uploaded CSV file to

  • saved.

Returns:

None

app.core.dataset_handler.save_df_to_dataset_button(automl: AutoMLSystem, name: str, data: DataFrame, asset_path: str) → None[source]

Displays a button in the Streamlit app to save a DataFrame as a dataset and register it with the AutoML system.

Parameters:

  • automl (AutoMLSystem) – The AutoML system instance to register

  • with. (the dataset)

  • name (str) – The name of the dataset.

  • data (pd.DataFrame) – The DataFrame containing the dataset.

  • asset_path (str) – The file path where the dataset asset will be saved.

Returns:

None

  • provided criteria. –

app.core.deployment_handler.preprocess_data(dataset: Artifact, pipeline: Pipeline) → ndarray[source]

Preprocesses the data by detecting feature types, validating pipeline input features, and concatenating input vectors into a compact observation vector.

Parameters:

  • dataset (Artifact) – The dataset to be preprocessed.

  • pipeline (Pipeline) – The pipeline containing the input features and

  • logic. (execution)

Returns:

The compact observation vector after preprocessing.

Return type:

np.ndarray

Raises:

  • ValueError – If the input features of the pipeline are not present in

  • the new data. –

app.core.modelling_handler.determine_task_type(target_feature: Feature, target_column: Series) → str[source]

Determines the type of machine learning task based on the target feature.

Parameters:

  • target_feature (Feature) – The target feature for which the task type

  • determined. (is to be)

  • target_column (pd.Series) – The column data of the target feature.

Returns:

The type of task, either ‘Classification’ if the target feature is categorical, or ‘Regression’ if the target feature is numerical.

Return type:

str

app.core.modelling_handler.display_pipeline_results(results: dict, pipeline: Pipeline) → None[source]

Display the pipeline results using Streamlit.

Parameters:

results (dict) – A dictionary containing the results of the pipeline. It should have the following keys: - ‘metrics’: The performance metrics of the pipeline. - ‘predictions’: The predictions made by the pipeline.

Returns:

None

app.core.modelling_handler.generate_target_and_input_features(dataset: Dataset, target_column: str, input_columns: list[str]) → tuple[Feature, list[Feature]][source]

Generates the target feature and input features from the given dataset.

Parameters:

  • target_column (str) – The name of the target column.

  • input_columns (list[str]) – A list of column names to be used as input

  • features.

Returns:

A tuple containing the target feature and a list of input features.

Return type:

tuple[Feature, list[Feature]]

app.core.modelling_handler.save_pipeline_button(automl: AutoMLSystem, pipeline: Pipeline) → None[source]

Displays a button to save a machine learning pipeline using Streamlit. This function renders a Streamlit interface to save a given machine learning pipeline. It prompts the user to input a name for the pipeline and provides a button to save the pipeline using pickle. Upon successful saving, a success message is displayed.

Parameters:

  • automl (AutoMLSystem) – The AutoML system instance that manages the

  • registry. (pipeline)

  • pipeline (Pipeline) – The machine learning pipeline to be saved.

Returns:

None

Parameters:

text (str) – The text to be written in the Streamlit app.

Returns:

None

app.core.system module

class app.core.system.ArtifactRegistry(database: Database, storage: Storage)[source]

Bases: object

A class used to register, get, delete, and list artifacts.

database

The database instance used by the system.

Type:

Database

storage

The storage instance used by the system.

Type:

Storage

delete(artifact_id: str) → None[source]

Deletes an artifact from the database and its associated asset from storage.

Parameters:

  • artifact_id (str) – The unique identifier of the artifact to be

  • deleted.

Returns:

None

get(artifact_id: str) → Artifact[source]

Retrieve an artifact from the database and storage.

Parameters:

  • artifact_id (str) – The unique identifier of the artifact to

  • retrieve.

Returns:

An instance of the Artifact class populated with data from the database and storage.

Return type:

Artifact

list(type: str = None) → List[Artifact][source]

Lists artifacts from the database, optionally filtered by type.

Parameters:

  • type (str, optional) – The type of artifacts to filter by.

  • None (If)

  • None. (all artifacts are listed. Defaults to)

Returns:

A list of Artifact objects.

Return type:

List[Artifact]

register(artifact: Artifact) → None[source]

Registers an artifact by saving its data to storage and its metadata to the database.

Parameters:

artifact (Artifact) – The artifact to be registered.

static get_instance() → AutoMLSystem[source]

Retrieves the singleton instance of the AutoMLSystem class. If the instance does not exist, it initializes it with LocalStorage and Database objects.

The singleton instance of the AutoMLSystem class.

Module contents

Includes all necessary functionality that the pages package needs to run the AutoML application.
